snippet: Andrew Simpson, a British sailor and Olympic gold medalist, was caught beneath the capsized boat, the team said. Simpson had been sailing for Artemis, Sweden’s entry in the America’s Cup.
abstract: Andrew Simpson, British sailor and Olympic gold medalist, dies after a 72-foot America’s Cup yacht owned by the Swedish team Artemis Racing capsizes during training in San Francisco Bay; accident could renew the debate about the new, high-speed and high-risk AC72 class of yachts that are being used for this Cup.

byline.contributor: Malia Wollan contributed reporting from San Francisco.

lead_paragraph: Andrew Simpson, a British sailor and Olympic gold medalist, was caught beneath the capsized boat, the team said. Simpson had been sailing for Artemis, Sweden’s entry in the America’s Cup.

headline.seo: Sailor Dies in America’s Cup Training as Yacht Capsizes
headline.main: Olympian Dies in America’s Cup Training After Yacht Flips
headline.print_headline: Olympian Dies in America’s Cup Training After Yacht Flips
